content.raw:
World frame is helpful because it is unambiguous and eliminates the concern over the image being inverted and also perhaps differences between ROS and Gazebo.  Either way is OK.  I guess reporting in head frame shows output that matches the answers file generated during the run, maybe makes it easier to compare.  
By the way, the code is well written and organized-- nice work!
content.html:
World frame is helpful because it is unambiguous and eliminates the concern over the image being inverted and also perhaps differences between ROS and Gazebo. Either way is OK. I guess reporting in head frame shows output that matches the answers file generated during the run, maybe makes it easier to compare.
By the way, the code is well written and organized-- nice work!
